I'm deep into #IndieWeb dilemma. My mind is still occupied with [discovering my old site](https://gerben.dev/notes/b556ca7cf2ba35cdc2d73977b7d1bd6b) and there's so many cool things there, that I somehow forgot. - I had a section called "Domain", which was a history of the site. Today that would probably be called "Colophon" - I had a section called "Fan" which would list image buttons of things I liked, apparently back then 100x31 was the norm, instead of [88x31](https://indieweb.org/88x31) - I had a "Playlist" page, because _back in my day_ you had to arrange your music manually.. - There was "Hostees", which I had noooo idea what it was till I opened the page.. Apparently I was 'hosting' some of my friend's sites as subdomains on my site. - And there's "Exits", which were apparently links to resources, cool websites etc. The entire thing was a bunch of ``'s and inline HTML (+ some CSS), but it worked, and even now in a version where the remote CSS file and images don't work in [web.archive.org](https://web.archive.org), it still looks very palatable.. So the 'dilemma' is that I changed so many layouts (which was fun), everything was so simple, I barely used paragraphs (apparently) and my content table was `480px` and in the middle of the page with a `
`. Now, on _gerben.dev_, I wouldn't dare to do all that.. everything has to be **perfect**.. and now I'm thinking whether that is ruining the fun.. I'm trying to rewrite my layout in a different branch, but it's so much work. ðŸ«
